The position will be tasked with maintaining and enforcing data quality standards and overall data management best practices.Perform data audits to ensure data accuracy, taking additional external research steps as needed.Ensuring that quality data is available at the right time, and available to the right people.Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand data requirements and create standard definitions for key metrics used throughout the firm.Build automated data quality rules to identify and cleanse inaccurate records.Respond to data related support requests representing validation of records, cleansing and migration of merger information from legacy applications.Monitor existing inbound/ outbound integrations within the practice management system to maintain the overall data integrity of the firm.Perform root cause analyses of issues and ensure remediation according to data management policies and standards.Create various ad-hoc reports representing various requests from the firm.Assist in testing data as updates to applications are made in various systems.Other duties and projects as assignedQualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. Prior experience in a professional services firm preferred.1 - 3 years of experience requiredExperience leading data governance strategies within SQL Server and Azure SQL environments.Strong SQL and data testing skills; Experience in constructing complex SQL queries.Knowledge of data profiling, root cause analysis and quality improvement techniques.Ability to translate user requirements to technical specifications.Excellent Microsoft Office Suite skills required. Proficiency with Excel and Access, a plus.Requires professionalism, diplomacy, organization, creativity and ability to manage multiple project requests simultaneously in a timely manner.Must be able to communicate effectively with all levels of staff and work well in a team-focused environment.High-level verbal and written communication skills required; Strong technical documentation skills.

DetailsPOSTING TITLE: Temporary Digital Marketing Data AnalystKemper is one of the nation’s leading specialized insurers. Our success is a direct reflection of the talented and diverse people who make a positive difference in the lives of our customers every day. We believe a high-performing culture, valuable opportunities for personal development and professional challenge, and a healthy work-life balance can be highly motivating and productive. Kemper’s products and services are making a real difference to our customers, who have unique and evolving needs. By joining our team, you are helping to provide an experience to our stakeholders that delivers on our promises.POSITION SUMMARY:The Digital Marketing Data Analyst supports the Kemper Corporation and its businesses by setting up, pulling, and analyzing data from social and digital campaigns and initiatives to provide actionable insights and recommendations. They will focus on identifying patterns in the data and will generate ideas for unique data-based stories, building out scalable reports and data visualizations to help make the insights actionable and digestible across the business. This role blends creative, strategic, analytic and project coordination skills.PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Plan and implement tracking and measurement in support of digital marketing initiatives (ex. A/B testing, web visitor data, paid media campaigns)Extract data from various digital toolsBuild and integrate attribution modelsDefine a measurement framework and identify KPIs by campaign / initiativeWork with IT / digital team members to ensure proper campaign setup for tracking and analysisManage data accuracy and integrityDesign and build dashboards and reports that align to campaign and initiative objectivesSynthesize and interpret digital marketing data into an analysis focused narrative, touching on business performance and generating actionable insights to help optimize future effortsMINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS:4+ years of professional experience with digital marketing data and analysisDemonstrated ability to connect paid media tools, CRM, and social media reporting tools with Google Analytics to gain integrated digital marketing insightsExperience with attribution modelingPrior experience in an enterprise B2B marketing environmentStrong data visualization experienceDeep experience in data analysis and report generation with Excel and TableauStrong technical abilities (SQL, Python, etc) and experience working with databasesExceptional attention to detailExpert knowledge in digital metrics, dimensions and KPIsUnderstanding of the “why” behind the projects is highly desirableAbility to work independently, proactively identify potential issues and work towards solutionsResults-oriented team player with the ability to build and maintain productive relationships with peers and cross-functional teamsAbility to work independently, execute tasks efficiently, and be flexible and adaptive to changing prioritiesExcellent organizational / time management skills and ability to effectively manage multiple projects, set priorities, and execute on tight deadlinesQuick learner and self-starterThe above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified. The incumbent must have the abilities or aptitudes to perform each essential function proficiently with or without reasonable accommodation. Our organization has a dynamic work environment where positions evolve and change. Therefore, the Company reserves the right to modify, delete, or add job duties, responsibilities and skills that are stated in this job description at any time.Kemper is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, disability status or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. description: JLL, an international real estate management company, is seeking a staff analyst to join our Data organization – Data Management and Delivery team. Senior Data Analyst(Job Number: 210000IQ)DescriptionChicago Public Schools (CPS) is the third-largest school district in the United States, serving over 340,000 students in 600+ schools and employing nearly 36,000 people, most of them teachers. CPS has set ambitious goals to ensure that every student, in every school and every neighborhood, has access to a world-class learning experience that prepares each for success in college, career, and civic life. In order to fulfill this mission, we make three commitments to our students, their families, and all Chicagoans: academic progress, financial stability, and integrity. Six core values are embedded within these commitments – student-centered, whole child, equity, academic excellence, community partnership, and continuous learning.The Department of School Quality Measurement and Research (SQMR), where this position is located, supports this work by providing timely and accurate data to stakeholders throughout CPS (families, schools, central office leaders, etc.) working to meet these goals.The Senior Data Analyst will be held accountable for the following responsibilities:Typical Duties/Responsibilities:Manage process for writing and executing code to calculate various performance metrics. Metric calculations will be performed in SAS and the process will include developing and/or maintaining detailed documentation for metric calculation work.Compile, manipulate, and analyze data using appropriate statistical techniques and produce reports.Fulfill internal and external requests for performance data (including Freedom of Information Act requests) in a timely manner using SAS and Microsoft Office.Implement a quality assurance process to make sure that code for metric calculations and other data requests is checked for accuracy before being finalized.As needed and available, develop and communicate reports with descriptive statistics on various performance metrics.Work collaboratively with IT staff to ensure warehousing of metric and rating data. Work collaboratively with other departments to maintain an understanding of data needs and work that may require support from SQMR.In order to be successful and achieve the above responsibilities, the Senior Data Analyst must possess the following qualifications:Type of Education Required:A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in a quantitative fieldAn advanced degree preferredType of Experience Required:A minimum of five years of professional data analytics experience in a role requiring relationship management and consultative skillsExperience with managing large data sets (pulling data from multiple data sets, merging data sets, etc.) and applying complex rules to create custom indicators required. Experience in working with educational data strongly preferredKnowledge, Skills, and Abilities:Experience writing code with data analytic tools (SAS preferred, R, SPSS, STATA, etc.)Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneouslyFlexibility to meet changing department needs and prioritiesExceptional organizational, communication (oral and written), project management, and problem-solving skillsStrong attention to detailAbility to work in a fast-paced environment, respond immediately to multiple constituencies, and meet established deadlinesAbility to work in a team, with technical and non-technical personnel, and across departmental boundariesAbility to understand and apply detailed programming specifications and in a complex data management environmentKnowledge of educational performance measures, educational research, and urban education systems a plusResidency Requirement:As a condition of employment with the Chicago Public Schools (CPS), employees are required to live within the geographic boundaries of the City of Chicago within six months of their CPS hire date and must maintain residency throughout their employment with the district.

Will start off remote but will be onsite once offices open. Non locals are ok but they have to relocate here later on. Must haves from the hiring manager: Alteryx SQL Tableau Must come out of Investment company/financial services. Understand and work with financial services data As a Regulatory Data Analyst, you will be part of the Data Analytics team, and will be supporting our client’s regulatory & compliance efforts. This role will be responsible for delivering data outputs to meet critical U.S. and international regulatory reporting needs. The analyst will understand the regulatory and compliance requirements, define the data required, work with the appropriate internal teams to source and validate the data, and deliver the appropriate data outputs. In addition to solving for immediate data needs, the analyst will also participate in the development of strategic data sourcing models for developing long-term capabilities, in conjunction with our technology and data teams. The role will require the development of deep understanding of data repositories and the business context of the data they contain as well, and the technical skills to define repeatable, robust processes to utilize these data sources. The analyst will work with Legal & Compliance, Operations, Data Management, Client Service, Technology, and Finance. Responsibilities: Support the ongoing deliveries to satisfy Regulatory & Compliance data and reporting needs Understand requirements for regulatory filings and working with Legal & Compliance to define and structure deliverables Develop knowledge about firm processes, operational systems, and data sources Perform activities for data extraction, data validation, data cleansing, data harmonization, exception handling, and data transformation Create appropriate documentation – build a data inventory including field definitions, list of values, and mappings Work closely with internal teams in identifying critical data gaps and providing and practical business solutions Participate in or develop strategic data sourcing models to transform existing processes and address data gaps to develop long-term capabilities Skills Required: 3+ years of experience working on data, reporting, or analytical projects in a financial services organization – preferably in asset management, broker-dealer, or wealth management Hands-on experience working with operational data within financial services such as orders, trades, financial instrument data, positions, valuations etc., and working knowledge of the business context for such data Highly proficient in SQL, creating complex queries, and building and analyzing datasets Adept at data exploration and able to quickly understand how to link and model disparate data sets Strong technical skills and business analysis skills Undergraduate degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics, or other quantitative field or deep professional experience in data, reporting, and analytics Experience with Alteryx or other ETL tools to speed up data gathering and analysis processes Experience within a compliance department, internal audit, or legal department

Company DescriptionPresent in over 100 countries and employing nearly 80,000 professionals, Publicis Groupe is the third largest communications group in the world. Publicis Groupe is listed on the Euronext Paris [FR0000130577] and is part of the CAC 40 index. Active across the entire value chain, Publicis Groupe offers its major clients a transversal, unified and fluid model allowing them access to all the Groupe’s tools and expertise around the world through the mantra "The Power of One"​.Job DescriptionThe Senior Analyst, Data Integrity position is responsible for providing data and insights that will drive the organization’s HR programs and initiatives. This position will require a keen attention to detail and the ability to collaborate and communicate with people of all job levels and personalities. The Senior Analyst, Data Integrity is responsible for maintaining data integrity within the organization's various HR systems and will be tasked with creating and formalizing processes to ensure this. The ideal applicants will have strong customer service and problem solving skills.

Job Responsibilities

Citi Retail Services Technology is looking for IT Business Data Analysts with broad experience and an interest to develop and Implement data management strategy. In this role, you will collaborate with Data Governance team and other analytical users for developing the data strategy and solutions. As a Data Analyst, you will be part of a distributed team and work independently as well as in tight collaboration with the Data Stewards, analytical users and other shared service technology teams. We'll need you to be a great communicator and influencer, and, especially, a collaborator. You will regularly collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver technology guidance, requiring a clear understanding of the desired outcomes and a solid grasp of the overall technology roadmap.

This role is a Lead IT Business Analyst that will support the implementation of the Citi Data Management Policy and Standards (CDMP). The CDMP establishes minimum requirements for the implementation of a consistent and controlled approach to create and use data as a critical corporate asset across Citi. The Policy also establishes a Governance Model for Data Management, Governance and Quality across Citi. This positions requires extensive data analysis expertise and past experience in managing and/or supporting applications from a technology perspective. This role will directly interact and partner closely with Data Custodians (IT Application Owners) for the implementation of Data Quality rules within application(s)

job_title: Analyst – Digital & Data Analytics Practice (Full Stack)
description:
At Stout, we’re dedicated to exceeding expectations in all we do – we call it Relentless Excellence(SM). Both our client service and culture are second to none, stemming from our firmwide embrace of our core values: Positive and Team-Oriented, Accountable, Committed, Relationship-Focused, Super-Responsive, and being Great communicators. Sound like a place you can grow and succeed? Read on to learn more about an exciting opportunity to join our team.

Full Stack Analysts in the Digital & Data Analytics group will be part of a great team focused on developing and creating innovative solutions to solve real-world problems across different industries.

At Stout, you’re engaged in real work right away.

As an Analyst, a typical day might include:

Building and setting up environments
Creating web pages or designing prototypes
Extracting and transforming data from multiple source feeds
Using cloud technologies to build scalable software
Automating repetitive, labor-heavy tasks
Optimizing digital services and processes
Writing and querying databases

As a Digital & Data Analytics Analyst, you will be part of a firm where the culture and exceptional client service is inspired from leadership down.

The Analyst should have a passion for technology and creating tangible, useable software, and should have the following academic and professional experience:

Completion of an undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related areas
General understanding of principles and theories applied to application design and architecture
Knowledge in one or more related fields, including: Data Structures, Cloud Computing, networking, databases, data integration, data encryption and security
Proficiency with front end languages, such as JavaScript, HTML and CSS
Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks, such as Angular JS and React
Sound programming skills in server-side languages, such as Python, Java, Scala or .NET
Understanding of software design patterns and OOP architecture
Solid knowledge of database technologies, including relational (e.g., SQL, MySQL, etc.) and non-relational (e.g., MongoDB, CouchDB, etc.) databases
Understanding of cloud computing and skills in one cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Knowledge of code versioning tools (Git, SVN, etc.)
Understanding of security and data protection
Coursework/practical experience with:

A variety of design patterns like MVC, singleton, proxy, factory, etc.
Knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery)
Proficiency with Git or other source control tools
OOP programming languages, such as Python, Java or Scala
Relational (e.g., SQL Server, MySQL) and non-relational (e.g., MongoDB, CouchDB) databases
Cloud computing (Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services)


The specific statements shown in each section of this description are not intended to be all-inclusive. They represent typical elements and criteria necessary to successfully perform the job.

Stout is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of valid job requirements, qualifications and merit without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected genetic information, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by applicable local, state or federal law.

Interested in joining a rapidly growing group of bright, ambitious professionals in a work environment that values culture, diversity, and personal growth? Stout might just be the right place for you.

Data Quality Analyst

Summary

The Data Quality Analyst is responsible for evaluating and ensuring data quality across Wilands various data sources. In addition, the Data Quality Analyst is responsible for planning and executing data tests, evaluation of change over time, and evaluation of new data. This includes studying and evaluating current reporting, utilizing and improving current data evaluation methods, writing test plans/cases, planning the test schedules, coordinating test resources, executing test cases, verifying test results, and maintaining a reusable library of test cases to support future testing.

Job Responsibilities

Review and perform quality checks on existing data sources.
Review and perform quality checks of data performance in modeling and scoring.
Regular review of all standardized reporting about contact data and attribute data. Work with other analysts/teams as needed to accomplish the goal of assessing data quality. Analysis methodology should include standard analysis as well as use of Wiland proprietary methods of analysis.
Making recommendations to data owners about cadence of data build & rebuild based on analysis, drift evaluation, and other relevant analysis.
Study and test new ways to develop data using current tools, including partnering with owners of Wiland proprietary modeling platforms, with the goal of producing either (a) current data/datasets using improved methods or (b) new data/datasets using the established, performant methods or new methods.
Assist in leveraging existing data sources to their fullest potential for use in Wiland models and/or products.


Education, Experience & Qualifications

Bachelors Degree or higher in business or a quantitative discipline (Business Data Analytics, Data Analysis, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, etc.) or equivalent work experience. Must be able to produce college transcripts showing minimum 3.0 GPA.
2+ years of professional experience in applying data analysis in a business setting, with strong preference given to experience in direct and/or digital marketing. Experience with cooperative databases, circulation planning, advertising agencies, or brokers is a plus.
Experience with predictive modeling methods is a plus.
Solid quantitative and analytical aptitude and the ability to apply those concepts in a business setting, identifying relevant business questions and conceptualizing quantitative solutions (key measures, reporting, analysis, etc.).
2+ years experience with R, Python, or related statistical software package including extensive programming skills.
1+ years experience with databases, data access tools, and SQL.


Additional Details

Location: Niwot, CO
Department: Product Management
Compensation Range: $56,000 - $70,000. Total compensation for this role also includes a variable component.
Our benefits include: Medical, Dental and Vision, Flexible Spending Account, Basic and Voluntary Life/ADD&D Insurance, Short & Long-Term Disability, 401(k) Retirements Savings Plan, Generous PTO Accruals and Designated Company Holidays.
Must be a US citizen or authorized to work in the United States.
Wiland is an equal opportunity employer.

Department Summary:DISH is a Fortune 200 company with more than $15 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the first live, internet-delivered TV service – Sling TV – that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.Now we have our sights set on upending the wireless industry and unseating the entrenched incumbent carriers.We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win – it’s in our DNA. We’re looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need to achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.Opportunity is here. We are DISH.Job Duties and Responsibilities:DISH is currently looking for a dynamic, detail-oriented and data-driven analyst. This is an excellent opportunity for someone interested in influencing the direction of an entire organization. The ideal candidate will have a passion for tackling new challenges, everyday. No two days are the same in this role. Company Description

Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc. (BR), a $4 billion global Fintech leader and part of the S&P 500® Index, is a leading provider of investor communications and technology-driven solutions to banks, broker-dealers, asset and wealth managers and corporate issuers. At Broadridge, we do well by doing good. Our unique culture is guided by the Service-Profit Chain—the idea that success is mutual, directly connecting employee engagement, client satisfaction, and the creation of stockholder value. We enable better financial lives by powering investing, governance, and communications for our clients, their customers, and the financial services industry.

Critical thinking and problem solving skills, i.e. the ability to make decisions and assess riskStrong organizational and planning skillsStrong, clear communication (both written and oral English), including influencing skillsA motivational team player who has the ability to motivate and create consensusFlexible approach to workA champion of innovation and continual improvementAble to build and maintain strong relationships both internally and with clientsAbility to plan and deliver change and service improvements / efficiency

Minimum of five years experience in the mutual fund industryDemonstrated ability to review, interpret and analyze financial dataDetailed knowledge of investment company fees and performanceProven successful project management skillsKnowledge of mutual fund data, products, and servicesStrong written and verbal communication skillsAbility to combine information from various sourcesExcel, Power BI, Tableau, or other BI softwareExperience with SQLMust exhibit a proven ability to create and implement new ideasExperience with presentations to small- to medium-sized groups is essential

Your OpportunityThe Sales and Service Technology division supports client facing systems, sales support systems, and service systems. Salesforce.com is the foundation of the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems used by the Sales Technology team. Schwab has 14 Salesforce orgs, including the CRM Retail org, which supports sales for our Retail Branches. The CRM Retail org has automated integrations with many other Schwab systems.

As a member of the CRM Retail Sales Technology team, you will be immersed in a collaborative, innovative, and technically challenging environment. As a Salesforce Developer you will be responsible for design, development, and delivery of Salesforce artifacts. We're looking for team members that are eager to learn and implement new technologies and provide outstanding CRM solutions.What you are good at

Analyzing business and systems requirements and providing technical solutions to meet user requirements
Designing and developing solutions application platform integrating with backend systems and working closely with our development, QA, product teams and Architects
Ensuring timely delivery of project deliverables
Collaborating with business partners on issues
Partnering with application and data developers on designs, models and best in class implementation
Interacting with experts from across Schwab in different support organizations and business groups
Being a member of Agile team(s) that focuses on delivering what the client needs
Providing Tier 2 support for production issues, including fixes across platforms and on-call responsibilities working with production support team to ensure 24x7 availability of production systems

Assisting in design and development of data quality and data drift detection software
Implementing data integration ETL in Informatica Power Center
Providing production support for data issues, including data fixes across platforms
Leading efforts to analyze data models, data interfaces and dependencies of the older CRM platform; planning, specifying, and developing new data integrations and interfaces to enable retirement of the old platform
Working closely with DBAs, data analysts, developers, and production support to identify and fix data issues that cross platforms

What you have

Strong foundational understanding of application development concepts and technologies
Demonstratable problem solving and troubleshooting skills, coupled with a desire to take on responsibilities; solutions oriented
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to explain complex system issues in business terminology
Ability to effectively handle multiple, competing, high-priority projects with varying deadlines
Experience interfacing with business partners at various levels
Demonstrated ability to understand the business functions that the team supports
Ability to work independently as a member of an Agile scrum team
Track record of being detailed oriented; a self-starter having deliverables with minimal defects
Must be able to quickly grasp complex concepts and learn new technologies
Experience supporting production operations in a high-availability environment
Experience interfacing with multiple technology domain partners, including offshore vendor teams and internal groups
Must be able to coach and mentor junior members on the team

As a developer you will have the following skills and experience:

Required Skills:


Expert in building and changing Informatica flows using PowerCenter 10.3 or higher
Extensive knowledge of Oracle and/or SQL Server (pl/sql or T-SQL)
Expert level of SQL knowledge
Expert Data Analysis and profiling
Unix Shell Scripting

Plus Skills:


Salesforce Data Loader
Querying Teradata
Jira for Agile story and work management
Confluence Documentation
Control – M Job scheduling software

job_title: Sr Data Analyst, CX Data & Analytics
description: Job SummaryResponsible for creating and delivering analyses, analytical products, strategic recommendations, and actionable insights in support of leadership strategy development within the Customer Operations and Customer Experience organization. Partners with leadership in this organization to define business needs and creates analysis plan to best solve for these. Works cross-functionally to collect data and develop models to determine trends utilizing a variety of data sources. Imports, cleans, transforms, or manipulates data with the purpose of understanding or making conclusions from the data for decision making purposes. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as resource for colleagues with less experience.Job DescriptionCore ResponsibilitiesCollaborates with both the analytic organization and its technology partners to define and publish complex data products.Provides training to and acts as technical resource for team members.Acts as a subject matter expert in one or more data subject areas such as sales, call center, network operation and financial data.Serves as a team leader within a work group or on cross-functional teams; accepts team lead stretch assignments. Presents results, recommendations and business insights to broader senior leadership team.Produces a variety of reports, graphs, summaries and presentations that convey analytic results and align with business needs.Performs basic research on root cause of data anomalies that are uncovered through normal course of analysis.Writes complex SQL to query large data platforms such as Teradata, SQL server, Oracle and Hadoop to obtain data necessary for analysis. Combines data as needed from disparate data sources to complete analysis.Participates in defining business intelligence requirements for projects and data requests.Participates in multiple enterprise wide projects by providing data analysis to project leaders.Executes root cause, driver, opportunity, and impact analyses using a variety of analytics platforms, which may include PythonCreates executive-level analyses read outs, clearly summarizing the story of analysis findingsEngages with new data elements for use in analyses, ensuring validation and accuracy of these sources, acting as a subject matter expert and sharing findings and logic standards with other team membersCollaborates with analysts in other functional areas, including finance, to provide wholistic storyMay support development of automated insights products through use of tools such as TableauFollows best practices and established policies in business intelligence data analysis, maintenance and data quality.Creates technical documentation (internal).Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.Skills & EducationPreferred educational backgrounds in Data Science, Business Intelligence, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Finance, or similar quantitative fieldRequired skills: Advanced SQL, Analytics Insights, Impact Analysis, Root Cause & In-Depth Analyses, Microsoft ExcelPreferred skills: Teradata, Python, R, Tableau, Jupyter Notebook, Random Forest, Regression Testing, Data Modeling Software, Statistical TheoryEmployees at all levels are expected to:Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.Drive results and growth.Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.Disclaimer:This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications.Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer.EducationBachelor's DegreeRelevant Work Experience5-7 YearsSalary:Pay Range: $75,327.21 - $112,990.82Comcast intends to offer the selected candidate base pay within this range, dependent on job-related, non-discriminatory factors such as experience.Base pay is one part of the Total Rewards that Comcast provides to compensate and recognize employees for their work. Most sales positions are eligible for a Commission under the terms of an applicable plan, while most non-sales positions are eligible for a Bonus. Additionally, Comcast provides best-in-class Benefits. We believe that benefits should connect you to the support you need when it matters most, and should help you care for those who matter most. That’s why we provide an array of options, expert guidance and always-on tools, that are personalized to meet the needs of your reality – to help support you physically, financially and emotionally through the big milestones and in your everyday life. Please visit the compensation and benefits summary on our careers site for more details.

At Trane Technologies® we Challenge Possible. Our brands – including Trane® and Thermo King® - create access to cooling and comfort in buildings and homes, transport and protect food and perishables, connect customers to elevated performance with less environmental impact, dramatically reduce energy demands and carbon emissions, and innovate with a better world in mind. We boldly challenge what’s possible for a sustainable world.

Job Summary:

The primary function of the Coupa Data Insight Analyst is to support the Indirect Procurement teams with prescriptive and predictive analytics. The Coupa Data Insight Analyst will proactively develop automated system solutions to discover business opportunities, to provide actionable insights, to drive business results and system simplification, and to ensure the customer is successful. As we shift from descriptive to prescriptive analytics, this position will aid in the creation of the long-term goal of Orchestrated Indirect Spend Management for Trane Technologies. This role will support the process of identifying value and delivering incremental value for the company. The Coupa Data Insight Analyst will drive and deliver insights that will educate and influence business decisions by our Indirect Procurement Teams and internal customers procuring indirect goods and services. Davidson, NC is the preferred location, but this position does has the ability to sit remote.

Responsibilities:

Utilize new and/or existing functionality in the Coupa Procure-to-Pay suite that aids in guided buying and automation of procurement processes to provide actionable insights for Indirect Procurement stakeholders
Develop, influence, and maintain sophisticated analytical solutions that are predictive and prescriptive in efforts to align with business insight needs
Continuously search for, document, and present new ways to optimize and automate existing processes that will aid in answering “What will happen?” and “How can we make it happen?” types of questions
Participate in the identification, implementation and adoption of emerging technologies in the field of Advanced Analytics
Develop Key Performance Predictors (KPP’s) within Coupa that tell a data-driven story through prescriptive insights
Identify and support opportunities to reduce complexity, compress cycle time and automate day to day business processes
Retrieve, synthesize, and present critical data in a format that is immediately useful to answering questions, making business decisions, and improving system performance
Support the streamlining and automation of ad-hoc and standardized analytics and insights

Qualifications:

Previous related experience with data analytics required
Bachelor's Degree required
Technical Coupa experience prefered
Experience conducting quantitative and qualitative analysis with analytics techniques to solve business problems
Ability to establish new business process using advanced analytics tools
Experience discovering, developing, and maintaining advanced analytics opportunities
Proficiency in data visualization and use of the latest visualization tools to convey insights through analytics findings
Basic understanding of a variety of machine learning techniques and statistical tools
Understanding of procurement / supply chain category management & business processes
Strong written and verbal communication skills including the ability to deliver a clear story to influence stakeholders, which outlines your recommendations with data and insights

Benefits*: Trane-Technologies-Benefits-Offered.pdf

Base Pay Range (for Colorado Residents): $49,000-$102,000

job_title: Analyst – Digital & Data Analytics Practice (Full Stack)
description:
At Stout, we’re dedicated to exceeding expectations in all we do – we call it Relentless Excellence(SM). Both our client service and culture are second to none, stemming from our firmwide embrace of our core values: Positive and Team-Oriented, Accountable, Committed, Relationship-Focused, Super-Responsive, and being Great communicators. Sound like a place you can grow and succeed? Read on to learn more about an exciting opportunity to join our team.

Full Stack Analysts in the Digital & Data Analytics group will be part of a great team focused on developing and creating innovative solutions to solve real-world problems across different industries.

At Stout, you’re engaged in real work right away.

As an Analyst, a typical day might include:

Building and setting up environments
Creating web pages or designing prototypes
Extracting and transforming data from multiple source feeds
Using cloud technologies to build scalable software
Automating repetitive, labor-heavy tasks
Optimizing digital services and processes
Writing and querying databases

As a Digital & Data Analytics Analyst, you will be part of a firm where the culture and exceptional client service is inspired from leadership down.

The Analyst should have a passion for technology and creating tangible, useable software, and should have the following academic and professional experience:

Completion of an undergraduate or graduate degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related areas
General understanding of principles and theories applied to application design and architecture
Knowledge in one or more related fields, including: Data Structures, Cloud Computing, networking, databases, data integration, data encryption and security
Proficiency with front end languages, such as JavaScript, HTML and CSS
Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks, such as Angular JS and React
Sound programming skills in server-side languages, such as Python, Java, Scala or .NET
Understanding of software design patterns and OOP architecture
Solid knowledge of database technologies, including relational (e.g., SQL, MySQL, etc.) and non-relational (e.g., MongoDB, CouchDB, etc.) databases
Understanding of cloud computing and skills in one cloud platform (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Knowledge of code versioning tools (Git, SVN, etc.)
Understanding of security and data protection
Coursework/practical experience with:

A variety of design patterns like MVC, singleton, proxy, factory, etc.
Knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery)
Proficiency with Git or other source control tools
OOP programming languages, such as Python, Java or Scala
Relational (e.g., SQL Server, MySQL) and non-relational (e.g., MongoDB, CouchDB) databases
Cloud computing (Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services)


The specific statements shown in each section of this description are not intended to be all-inclusive. They represent typical elements and criteria necessary to successfully perform the job.

Stout is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of valid job requirements, qualifications and merit without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected genetic information, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by applicable local, state or federal law.

Interested in joining a rapidly growing group of bright, ambitious professionals in a work environment that values culture, diversity, and personal growth? Stout might just be the right place for you.

job_title: Sr. Data Quality Analyst/Data Governance Steward
description:
Are you passionate about data and the strategic advantage it gives when properly governed and democratized across an organization? This role will be a great fit for you if you have a strong understanding and passion for enterprise data organization, as well as user data privacy and security.

The Sr. Data Quality Analyst/ Data Governance Steward will help support the overall Data Quality & Governance initiative including, data quality and a data catalog.

Some of the key responsibilities include:

Proactively champion the value of quality data & data governance by promoting ideas into action; including assisting with developing and implementing communication, change management and adoption plans.
Serve as a liaison between the business and Data Services promoting collaboration and communication and ensuring that data quality related requirements are clearly defined, prioritized, and well understood.
Define the data and identify assets within data domains. This ensures there isn't conflict with other data elements.
Create processes and procedures along with access controls to monitor adherence. This includes establishing internal policies and standards—and enforcing those policies.
Maintain quality of the data using customer feedback, concerns, questions; internally reporting metrics; evaluating and identifying issues; and coordinating and implementing corrections regularly.
Optimize workflows and communications.
Monitor data usage to assist teams, share best practice trends in data use, and provide insight into how and where teams can use data to help in day-to-day decision-making.
Strive to elevate greater understanding across the data and analytics and business partners of the role of data governance and the importance of sustaining quality data
Assist the team actively in day-to-day operations and project solutions.
Continually identify & partner with data stewards across the organization to execute the Enterprise Data Governance strategy
Use Looker, DBT & other technologies to design and develop solutions as part of the data quality & governance program including data quality dashboards & solutions t, data health scorecards to measure and monitor quality of data.
Ensure compliance and security of the data. Data stewards are responsible for protecting the data—while providing information on potential risks and offering regulatory guidance.
Make recommendations on Data Quality & Governance based on industry best practices.

You are a strong fit for this role if you have:

Advanced understanding and working knowledge in end-to-end data management principles
Expertise in data quality improvement techniques
Prior experience developing and executing on data governance strategy at the enterprise level
Demonstrable communication skills with the ability to positively influence the business and technical teams in the adoption of data quality and governance
Extensive understanding and experience working with various BI suite of tools, data integration and storage solutions, including extract, transform and load technologies and relational databases.

Why Guild? Our mission is to increase economic mobility for working adults by partnering with the largest employers in the country to offer education as a benefit to their employees via our marketplace of nonprofit universities and education institutions. As a B-corp we are truly aligned to deliver positive outcomes for our students, employer partners, and academic partners.

About Guild:

Guild is increasing economic mobility for working adults by partnering with the largest employers in the country to offer education as a benefit to their employees via our marketplace of nonprofit universities and education institutions. Guild's proprietary technology platform facilitates the administration of this innovative benefit and our team of coaches helps each employee navigate the path back to school, providing individualized support from day one through program completion.

We also just became the latest female-led company to hit a $1billion valuation and the only B-corp with those qualifications. Our Series D round was led by Ken Chenault, General Catalyst Partners chairman and former CEO of AMEX, and joined by Emerson Collective, LeadEdge Capital, and Iconiq.

Guild Education is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Additionally, we feel passionately about equal pay for equal work, and transparency in compensation is one vehicle to achieve that. Total compensation for this role is market competitive, including a base salary range of $90,000-$112,500 as well as company stock options.

Access to low-cost, high-quality health care options through Cigna and Kaiser (due to coverage limitations, Kaiser is currently only available in CA & CO)
Access to a 401k to help save for your future
3 weeks of vacation in your first year and an open vacation policy after year 1 to help you recharge
8 days of fully-paid sick leave, so that you can take the time to heal and or recover 
Family-friendly benefits, including 14 weeks of parental leave, employer-paid short-term and long-term disability, employer-sponsored life insurance, and fertility care benefits.
Well-rounded wellness benefits including access to free and low cost mental health resources and support services
Education benefits and tuition assistance to help your future development and growth

Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the first live, internet-delivered TV service – Sling TV – that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.Now we have our sights set on upending the wireless industry and unseating the entrenched incumbent carriers. We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win – it’s in our DNA. Strong collaboration and facilitation skills are extremely helpful.Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management, Engineering, or BS in related technical field, or equivalent amount of education and experience.Ability to parse files in various formats.Preferred SkillsExperience working in the Wireless industryExperience with InformaticaExperience with Cloud based systems such as Salesforce.com3-5 years of experience performing large scale data migrations

COMPANY OVERVIEW:

TIAA is the leading provider of financial services in the academic, research, medical, cultural and government fields. We offer a wide range of financial solutions, including investing, banking, advice and education, and retirement services.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

The qualified candidate will be a highly motivated individual who has a passion for developing innovative/creative solutions in a fast-paced environment. This individual must be a self-starter who possesses exceptional technical and critical thinking skills, the ability to work independently, and must have excellent oral/written communication skills.

•Develop business intelligence reporting for the Individual Client Solutions production teams and supporting areas, including historical data trend analysis and visualizations that identify process improvement opportunities

•Using a combination of database and web technologies to deliver web-based self-service interfaces ranging from corporate-level scorecard metrics down to the performance of individual client services representatives

•Partner with business areas to define critical reporting needs and provide guidance regarding the availability of data and set expectations around delivery of results

•Work with our IT partners in establishing access to data sources, obtaining definitions of data sets and ensuring the reliability and accuracy of information

•Design and execute data extract/transform/load (ETL) scripts and environment migrations

•Ad-hoc analyses that span multiple databases of potentially mixed levels of normalization and “cleanliness”

•Provide support for development and infrastructure issues surrounding the availability of reporting platforms

•Prioritize the development, maintenance and support of multiple projects simultaneously

•Find creative and simple solutions to complex reporting problems

•Assist with special projects, data maintenance, and other day-to-day tasks

•Analyze data and present results to both technical and non-technical audiences

•Effectively manage workload by prioritizing ad-hoc requests, development efforts and analysis

•Navigate cross-functional TIAA business units in order to identify information dependenciesMinimum Pay: $57,800.00The organization is committed to making financial well-being possible for its clients, and is equally committed to the well-being of our associates. That’s why we offer a comprehensive Total Rewards package designed to make a positive difference in the lives of our associates and their loved ones. Alta Planning + Design is an active transportation company dedicated to creating active, healthy communities through planning, landscape architecture, engineering, and education/encouragement programs. Alta was founded in 1996 when cities and communities were calling for safer streets for people walking and bicycling as the non-motorized transportation movement developed into a profession in the United States. We pioneered the field of active transportation, evolving our planning and design work into a visionary global practice that empowers people to live active, healthy lives and getting them to where they need to go.Our core values and work bring about positive change by creating places that are geared toward moving people rather than cars, connecting community members to daily needs and human experience, and empowering every person to live an active healthy life. As a global leader in mobility innovation for over 24 years with 175 people on staff, we are dedicated to connecting people to places by working across disciplines and scale to address social justice, safety, and environmental resilience.Alta Planning + Design is seeking a Civic Data Analyst to join our team. This position can be based anywhere in the United States, but it would be great if you were near one of our many offices in the US. This is a unique opportunity for anyone who is passionate about active transportation and the way it positively impacts our communities in need. If you are looking for an innovative organization that is an industry leader in active transportation, apply with us today!Position PrioritiesAlta’s Civic Data Analysts are at the forefront of civic data analytics by bringing data-informed decision-making to a multidisciplinary practice. The Civic Analytics group at Alta leverages emerging technologies to bring multimodal metrics to narratives that enable communities to enhance transportation choice and encourage active and healthy lifestyles. If you are passionate about telling the stories of people on the move through data, this is the position for you.The essential priorities of this position are to:Thoroughly understand the firm’s data needs and capabilities, develop new products, track industry trends, and create process improvements and capabilities.Collaborate across Alta’s disciplines to understand their data analysis needs, priorities, and expectations.Support planners, designers, and engineers in tasks related to data analysis and visualization.Implement analytical solutions that bring valuable mobility insights and can scale across an organization.Engage with emerging technologies and datasets such as AI-derived asset databases, near-miss collision analysis, connected vehicle data, and other transportation-related datasets.Position ResponsibilitiesKey position responsibilities for this role include the following:Performing work in data science and visualization that requires the use of complex methodologies, challenging datasets, and close coordination with stakeholders.Conduct data analysis and develop visualization components of client projects and for research and development efforts.Writing reports, technical memos, and presentations.Developing and applying a variety of methods for the analysis of complex transportation and geospatial data sets.Keeping abreast of trends in technology and finding ways to connect them to solving challenges to mobility and access to opportunities.Keeping an eye on labor-intensive processes and analysis and identifying ways to streamline and automate them so they can create organization-wide value.RequirementsThis position requires a combination of skills, experience, and education including, but not limited to:Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field with demonstrated experience in the transportation planning field, OR a Bachelor’s Degree in Planning or Engineering with some experience in the software development and/or data science fields.Proficiency in Python and/or R, SQL.GIS Proficiency - both open-source (PostGIS, QGIS, geopandas, etc.) and the ESRI suite ( ArcGISPro, Spatial Analyst, Network Analyst, etc.).Demonstrated work of applied statistics or machine learning techniques to transportation challenges.Ability to create informative data visualizations through code (e.g. D3, ggplot, matplotlib, plotly, kepler.gl, etc.).Experience designing, implementing and documenting analytical solutions using code. JOBThe Office of Economic Development and International Trade (“OEDIT”) was created to foster a positive business climate that encourages quality economic development through support of local and regional economic development activities throughout the State of Colorado. A comprehensive slate of programs within OEDIT’s divisions work together to offer economic development services for all Colorado businesses – new and expanding, traditional and emerging, small and large – including retention programs to ensure continued competitiveness of Colorado’s economic base, and job training to keep Colorado’s workforce the best in the nation.EXAMPLE OF DUTIESOEDIT is seeking candidates for the Rural Economic Development Data Analyst position. This position is funded through a two-year Economic Development Administration grant. The chosen candidate will work with the Business Support and Rural Prosperity (BSRP) Team to collect and analyze demographic, socio-economic and business development trends across Colorado’s 54 rural counties to transform data into critical information and knowledge to assist with making sound organizational decisions. The Rural Economic Development Data Analyst will be responsible for both primary and secondary research activities, analysis and synthesis of data, plus the organization and delivery of internal and external projects. The nature of the work is both project- and team-based, with primary responsibilities for 1) identifying and reporting on trends to the BSRP director and staff, 2) overseeing and executing against strategic data analytics, while also updating the BSRP’s online data dashboard and 3) working across other agencies and departments while responding to requests for systematic, targeted data in support of statewide, regional and industry objectives.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSREQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS3+ years of relevant experience in economic development, business development, or economics. Expertise with analyzing data in Excel using Excel formulas and tools, EMSI, (Tableau/Google Data Studio), ARCGIS, Salesforce, OLS regressions and modeling, and knowledge and understanding of data from sources such as the Bureau of Labor and Statistics, the Bureau of Economic Analysis, Federal Reserve, the U.S. Departments of Commerce and Agriculture, and the Colorado Department of Local Affairs.Experience in data visualization or design.Knowledge of the principles and practices of policy analysis including policy development, coordination, economic analysis, cost-benefit analysis, and implementation.Problem-solving skills.Interpersonal and communication skills.The ability to prepare clear and concise objective analyses and recommendations.Ability to gather information.Ability to meet deadlines.Ability to multitask.Ability to think creatively.Familiarity with Colorado’s rural communities and their diverse economies.COMPETENCIES Ability to ConceptualizeAnalytical Problem SolvingAttention to DetailCollaborationGlobal PerspectiveInformation MonitoringEDUCATIONBachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics or related major in a public or accredited private academic institution requiredSUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATIONApplicants should submit a cover letter, resume, and references in one document to The Office of Economic Development and International Trade by e-mail at oedit.info@state.co.us with the subject line “Rural Opportunity Data Analyst" by April 16, 2021. Due to the large volume of resumes we receive, we do not acknowledge receipt of each resume and are unable to give status updates. If a strong match is found between your qualifications and the requirements of the position, a member of the recruiting staff will contact you to further discuss the career opportunity.We offer a generous benefits package including: • Annual leave accrued at 13.33 hours per month• Sick leave accrued at 6.66 hours a month• 10 paid holidays per year• Medical and dental plans• State paid life insurance policy of $50,000• Choice of 2 retirement plans• 401K and 457 plans• State paid Short Term Disability coverage• Additional optional life and disability plans• Credit Union Membership• RTD pass• Training and professional developmentTo learn more about State of Colorado benefits visit: https://www.colorado.gov/dhr/benefits.ADAAA Accommodations: Any person with a disability as defined by the ADA Amendments Act of 2008 (ADAAA) may be provided a reasonable accommodation upon request to enable the person to complete an employment assessment. To request an accommodation, please contact Michelle Hunter by phone (303) 866-6309 or email michelle.m.hunter@state.co.us at least five business days before the assessment date to allow us to evaluate your request and prepare for the accommodation. You may be asked to provide additional information, including medical documentation, regarding functional limitations and type of accommodation needed. Please ensure that you have this information available well in advance of the assessment date.

For close to 30 years, PASCO has been providing industry-leading care and advocacy programs for a broad range of clients with disabilities and their families. Our primary mission is to help our clients lead rich and fulfilling lives while in the comfort and safety of their own homes. One of the main ways we achieve this goal is by consistently advancing our employees through support, training, and ongoing development. Come join our team today and help us make a difference in the lives of countless people!PASCO is growing rapidly and is looking for an Operations / Finance Data Analyst to join our team! The Data Analyst will support PASCO to better use and understand information across the organization. The intersection of operations with financial outcomes will be a key focus on gathering, interpreting, and disseminating information and analysis to the team. This role will help to promote insights across the business based on priorities set by the CEO and leadership team. The Data Analyst will partner with our Technology Solutions team to build routine data reports while diving into complex problems on an ad hoc basis to understand key indicators of outcomes.Responsibilities:Develop an understanding of the PASCO business and the underlying data elements that inform performance trendsBuild regular reports and systems that can be accessed by decision-makers within operations, sales & marketing, Billing/Payroll and Employee/Client Services to improve accuracy, timeliness, and efficiency, as well as replace manual processes, as appropriateConduct ad hoc projects to dive into specific business questions based on operational and/or financial results using SQL queries and data manipulation and presentation in MS ExcelLead projects, partnering with Technology Solutions team, to move disparate data sets and processes into more structured formats (e.g., SQL database storage and reporting)Create SQL queries and stored procedures to automate reporting from data warehousing structure and/or available systems data from Electronic Health Records (EHR) system(s), Human Resources Information System (HRIS), Payroll system, or related business operating systemsDevelop written communication explaining trends and business impact of the data under reviewPASCO has great office hours, a close-knit team, and an industry-leading benefits package, which includes:Excellent health benefitsSick, vacation, and holiday pay up to 3 weeks of PTO per yearFree life insuranceA bonus programFlexible Spending AccountWeekly paychecksTarget Base Compensation: $80,000 - $100,000Some of the things we need you to have:Five (5) or more years’ experience working in a role involving data manipulation and analysis; Operations, Finance, Sales and/or Marketing experience is a plusComfort with SQL query development, or interest in learning SQL queriesExcellent analytical skillsInterest and strength in solving problemsAbility to manipulate large data sets quickly and accuratelyAdvanced competency in MS Excel functions and capabilities, including but not limited to pivot tables, lookup functions, and index & match functions. Experience with VBA / macros a plus.Familiarity with Finance concepts like revenue recognition, fixed and variable costs, gross margin and profit, profitability by service lineDemonstrated ability to work independently on projects while collaborating with clarifying questionsBachelor’s degree in economics, business, psychology, and/or related data relevant degree is preferredMaster’s degree in business, economics, psychology or related data relevant degree is a plusExperience building statistical models is a plusEOE M/F/D/V/G E-verify Employer

company: Planned Parenthood of the Rocky Mountains, Inc.
description: Planned Parenthood is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity, equity, inclusion, respect, integrity, customer focus, and innovation. We are committed to creating a welcoming space for people of all genders on our staff, in our health centers, and in our community. We do this by tending to the team, respecting and honoring all people, jumping in, trying and learning, caring for our business, and returning to our mission.  Planned Parenthood of the Rocky Mountains, which includes health centers in Colorado, Southern Nevada, New Mexico, and Wyoming has been helping individuals make responsible choices for over 100 years. Since 1916, we have been committed to delivering the highest quality reproductive health care, teaching responsible and age-appropriate sexuality education and have been working diligently to protect a person's right to reproductive choice. Each year more than 100,000 people visit our health centers throughout our four state region.RESPONSIBLE TO: Manager of Development Services POSITION SUMMARY: Development Data Analyst I is responsible for accurate gift processing, gift entry, and appropriate acknowledgement of all contributions PPRM receives; maintains accurate donor records; runs weekly financial and donor reports, and implements the patient donation program. This position is hourly, non-exempt.SALARY: $15.50 - $17.70, depending on experienceSCHEDULE: Typically Monday through Friday, 9 to 5. QUALIFICATIONSOne year of experience in data entry, queries, and exportsOne year in fundraising experience OR one year experience working at a Planned Parenthood affiliateFamiliarity with the Raiser’s Edge software or other comparable software programs is preferredMust be well versed with the Microsoft Office Suite with emphasis on Microsoft ExcelMust possess excellent communication and critical thinking skillsMust be detail oriented and have strong organization and time management skillsAble to work flexible hours. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSMaintain integrity of Raiser’s Edge and NXT databases by entering and updating donor and gift records, responding to information from various sources including donors, staff, third party platforms, Planned Parenthood Federation of America, mail house, obituary records, and government recordsProcess and enter all gifts, pledges, pledge payments, and in-kind gifts accurately and within established timeline, including gifts made through PPFA, various online platforms, and third partiesGenerate timely IRS-compliant acknowledgement for contributionsServe as contact for incoming calls and emails related to donations, and correspond with donors in a timely manner to resolve inquiresProduce simple queries, exports, imports, and reports, including weekly financial updates, stewardship reports, and mail listsAssist in training staff and volunteers on managed databases, and ensure compliance of policies and proceduresMaintain policies and procedures for managed databasesImplement the Health Center/Patient Donation Program by facilitating staff trainings, and tracking and reporting progressMaintain other records including but not limited to a sample book of printed materials, invoices and expenses, and audit filesAdvocate for technology solutions as appropriate and keep abreast of emerging technologiesWork with Development team members to create and adhere to the strategic plan and annual budget Support the Manager of Development Services and Director of Donor Relations and Operations to achieve desired fundraising goalsSupport agency-wide objectives through, but not limited to visibility at internal and external events, and by participating on task forces, committees, and engagement with external partners Other duties as requiredParticipates in abortion services (participation can include referrals, information, education, counseling, performing, scheduling, etc.)Background Check RequiredPlanned Parenthood of the employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by job_title: Data Analyst 3 - Credit Risk Collections Strategy
description: Data Analyst 3 - Credit Risk Collections StrategyJob DescriptionThe Credit Risk Collections Strategy Team is responsible for the strategies and initiatives that help protect the business from losses. Advanced degree preferred.o Three to six years’ experience applying statistical modeling and inference, preferably in the consumer credit card industry.o Formal training in statistical modeling and experimental design preferred, but not required (depending on experience)o Demonstrated experience using advanced analytics such as cluster analysis, regression and decision trees to develop innovative solutionso Proven success developing SQL/SAS programs that produce output and reporting in a seamless, fully-automated fashion.o Knowledge of the Consumer Credit Industry preferred.o Ability to identify a problem, create and execute an analytical plan, and make actionable analytically derived recommendationso Ability to effectively communicate and present complex data and analytical issues to core stakeholders and partners across the enterpriseo Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and work in a fast-paced environment as part of a team.We’ve got you covered…We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, vision and dental coverage, a fabulous merchandise discount, an employer-matched 401(k) plan, a profit-sharing plan and much more.We are an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a diverse environment.This job description is intended to describe the general nature of the work employees can expect within this particular job classification. job_title: Data Insight Analyst - Ally Clearlane Analytics
description: Ally and Your CareerAlly Financial only succeeds when its people do - and that's more than some cliche people put on job postings. We live this stuff! We see our people as, well, people - with interests, families, friends, dreams and causes that are all important to them. Our focus is on the health and safety of our teammates as well as work-life balance and diversity and inclusion. From generous benefits to a variety of employee resource groups, we strive to build paths that encourage employees to stretch themselves professionally. We want to help you grow, develop, and learn new things. You're constantly evolving, so shouldn't your opportunities be, too?The OpportunityAlly Clearlane is an online financing platform that allows consumers to save money by refinancing their existing auto loans and leases. Clearlane represents a key aspect of Ally's overall digital strategy to continually expand our online capabilities for consumers.This position will play a meaningful role in supporting business growth and web analytics through extensive data analysis, modeling, and reporting with regards to Ally Clearlane business. As one team member of the Clearlane data analytics team, you will thrive in a fast-paced innovative culture that turns data into information and uses that information to drive business actions.This role will require a proactive, nimble mind to maintain business requirements in real-time while also thinking creatively to deliver thoughtful analysis. All of these will directly contribute to Ally's excellence as a best-in-class employer and auto-lender.The Work ItselfCreate and maintain sophisticated and optimized SQL queries to extract data and build data pipelines for analytics and reporting.Perform data science analyses using Python to uncover insights from datasets and help the business to answer the why and how.Implement website tracking and analytics tags and support the validation of new features across the website.Define KPIs, develop and maintain dashboards to address business needs and proactively identify areas of optimization and growth.Conduct funnel analysis for the web analytics data and make recommendations for optimizations.Design and analyze A/B tests to optimize website performance.Build ad hoc reports and analyses based on requests from business teams.Collaborate with Digital Experience, Sales and Operations teams, and Senior Leadership to analyze and synthesize complex data into concise action-oriented recommendations for the business.The Skills You BringBachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Science, or other quantitative fields. Master's degree is a plus2+ years of related technical experience, including data analysis, web/business analytics, or quantitative analysis preferred.Proficient with Python for data science problems. Experience with predictive modeling, machine learning, and A/B testing preferred.Strong experience using SQL, ETL and databases in a business environment with large-scale, and complex datasets.Experience in data visualization platforms (e.g. Microsoft Power BI).Hands-on experience in selecting the right statistical tools given a data analysis problem.Exceptional analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable information.Detail-oriented with outstanding problem-solving skills.Effective communication and presentation skills to work with people at all levels.Understanding of Agile methodology is a plus.How We'll Have Your BackAlly's compensation program offers market-competitive base pay and pay-for-performance incentives (bonuses) based on achieving personal and company goals. But Ally's total compensation - or total rewards - extends beyond your paycheck and is designed to support and enrich your personal and professional life, including:Time Away: competitive holiday and flexible paid-time-off, including time off for volunteering and voting.Planning for the Future: plan for the near and long term with an industry-leading 401K retirement savings plan with matching and company contributions, student loan and 529 educational assistance programs, tuition reimbursement, and other financial well-being programs.Supporting your Health & Well-being: flexible health and insurance options including dental and vision, pre-tax Health Savings Account with employer contributions and a total well-being program that helps you and your family stay on track physically, socially, emotionally and financially.Building a Family: adoption, surrogacy, and fertility support as well as parental and caregiver leave, back-up child and adult/elder day care program and child care discounts.Work-Life Integration: other benefits including LifeMatters® Employee Assistance Program, subsidized and discounted Weight Watchers® program and other employee discount programs.Who We AreAlly Financial is a customer-centric, leading digital financial services company with passionate customer service and innovative financial solutions. We are relentlessly focused on "Doing it Right" and being a trusted financial-services provider to our consumer, commercial, and corporate customers. For more information, visit www.ally.com.Ally is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic disposition or any other reason protected by law.We are committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical or mental disabilities. For accommodation requests, email us at work@ally.com. Ally will not discriminate against any qualified individual who is capable of performing the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation.
