Eurest is recognized worldwide for standards of service and excellence within the foodservice industry. Embracing an ownership mindset, Eurest leverages global resources, promotes a local presence and enriches the communities we serve. The Eurest Promise, “connect with people, inspire through food, create solutions, and live our promise,” is exemplified throughout our organization. Eurest is proud to serve the world’s most respected successful corporations, including many of the Fortune 500.

SUMMARY

We are looking for a Power BI Analystwho will be responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of Power BI dashboards and reports supporting Business Intelligence using Microsoft Power BI. Here you will analyze data to create Executive level key reports to help drive our innovative initiatives within hospitality.

You are a creative thinker who understands user interface design and melds visualizations skills such as user experience design, data visualization and graphical design.

You are responsible for providing business stakeholders with fact-based decision-making results, enabling them to quickly make changes, as appropriate, that may affect diverse areas.

You are a team player with a positive attitude, collaborative mindset and excellent interpersonal and motivational skills, who can work well with technical and non-technical staff across numerous areas. The candidate should also be able to manage competing priorities through effective communication and time management skills.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following: (other duties may be assigned)

Translate ad-hoc requests into re-usable data products that scale to answer larger questionsPartner with stakeholders to help guide and understand their analytical thought processDevelop robust data visualization products that clearly communicate ideasDefine and owns metrics that capture the spirit of business objectives as closely as possibleWork with business stakeholders and other analysts to maintain the consistency and reliability of the data warehouseBoil technical findings down into business recommendationsWork with business stakeholders to drive business results

TECHNICAL QUALIFICATIONS

3+ years of Business Intelligence experience in a professional settingProficiency with SQL, including relational database experienceProficiency with Power BI and data visualization Experience with Azure services a plus

OTHER QUALIFICATIONS

Strong oral and written communication skills and are able to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to a broad range of audiencesExcellent people and management skills to interact with colleagues, cross-functional teams and stakeholders3+ years building tailored Power BI visualizations and defining required supporting data architecture (e.g., data marts).Experience collaborating with both business and IT partners to identify key use cases and define associated requirements.Provide thought leadership, best practices, and standards required to deliver effective and sustainable solutions to clients.Experience writing & validating complex SQL queriesStrong attention to detail, coupled with a deep bias to action and a healthy dose of pragmatismExperience gathering requirements and talking to usersFamiliarity with basic design concepts & common dashboard development patternsProven ability to execute on projects quickly; get things done mentalityUnabashed question asker; willing to learn anything needed to get things done

Education: Bachelor’s degree preferred and 3+ years of professional experience as a BI Analyst

Aerojet Rocketdyne is a world-recognized aerospace and defense leader providing propulsion and energetics to its space, missile defense, strategic, tactical missile and armaments customers throughout domestic and international markets. The Technical Data Management Analyst is part of our Quality Assurance organization and works with a variety of technical documents to ensure completeness, accuracy and compliance with company and customer processes. This position will be located at our facility in Redmond, WA. 35% - Perform record screening, retention, staging, assembling and filing to ensure systematic and reliable documentation flow of statistical and technical data for the purpose of creating end item data packages, with minimum errors and omissions. This is to include the screening of incoming work orders for completeness, accuracy and compliance. Review test data against stated acceptance criteria. Perform scanning and computer data entry into company data bases and spreadsheets as needed. 25% - Assemble end-item data packages for presentation to program quality engineers and external customers. Coordinate with quality engineers, customer representatives and government inspectors, as applicable to obtain approval of completed data packages. Must act as a liaison between management and Aerojet Rocketdyne customer during end item data book review time. 15% - Obtain required data package inputs from program engineering, reliability engineering, and quality engineering, to predict product reliability prior to customers review. 15% - Maintain electronic data management files and integrated filing system for all manufacturing related documents, by logically categorizing and organizing all files within the department. 10% - Provide weekly progress reports on status of individual program assignments. Report status on workload and scheduling impacts to supervisor, and as needed to upper management. Work with Scheduling Integration and Program Office on budget recommendations for the processing of end item data books.Requires a Bachelor's degree in an appropriate discipline and three (3) years experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Must have strong research, organization, time management, communication (both verbal and written) and interpersonal skills. The ability to work effectively with all levels within Aerojet Rocketdyne, as well as with external customers is essential. Must also have the ability to assess and adapt to an ever-changing work environment and formulate a course of action that meets customer’s expectations and accomplishes team and company goals for product quality and service. Knowledge of statistics, measurement principles and experience with Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Outlook) preferred. International Traffic in Arms Regulation (ITAR) knowledge and experience desired. US Citizenship required. Must also be able to satisfy federal government requirements for access to government information, and having dual citizenship may preclude you from being able to meet this requirement.  Work Environment and Physical Requirements:Employees in these positions must possess mobility to work in a standard office setting and to use standard office equipment, including a computer; stamina to sit or stand and maintain attention to detail despite interruptions; may occasionally lift/carry/push/pull up to 25 pounds; may require occasional walking, climbing, stooping, crouching, and/or bending; and vision to read printed materials and a computer screen, and hearing and speech to communicate in person and over the telephone. May require the ability to travel by air or auto. May require the use of personal protective equipment such as safety glasses, safety shoes, and shop coat. These positions may be expected to work varying shifts and hours to ensure successful operation of activities in the organization.

Redfin is redefining real estate in the consumer’s favor by combining our own technology and agents to create a service that’s better, faster, and costs less. As a Redfinnian, you'll make a difference in one of life’s most important events—buying or selling a home. Our hiring standards are high, yet our culture is humble. No matter what role you have, you’ll be both challenged and inspired every day. We’ve got all the perks, but if what you value most is doing great work in a creative, collaborative, and disciplined environment, join us.As a Senior Data Analyst focused on Recruiting, you will join a team that supports field and headquarters hiring to address critical questions about our talent acquisition and diversity programs. We need an analytical expert with a passion for details, curiosity about understanding customer needs, and a practical understanding of business operations to help us turn our data into tangible, usable insights and help drive one of the biggest parts of our business forward.The RoleConduct analysis, develop predictive metrics, and build scalable self-service dashboards to allow recruiting leaders to effectively track recruiting and retention metrics.Partner with People Operations, Real Estate Operations, Engineering, Finance and Program Management teams to answer tough questions that inform the business and drive strategic data-driven decision making.Use your technical and business expertise to make our recruiting operations more analytical, and our analytics more valuable.Provide executive-level insights on our progress in improving the quality of our workforce.Desired Skills & Experience4 -10 years working in an analytical role in a business context is required. Experience in analytics of people operations and HR is a strong plus.Expert-level SQL and Excel skills are required.Significant experience using data visualization/BI software (Tableau, Power BI) is required. Specifically, Tableau experience is a plus.Brilliant communication skills and ability to explain complex ideas clearly to a non-technical audience.Strong consultative and influencing skills to help leaders make decisions and move the business forward.Bachelor’s degree in business, statistics, operations research, economics, computer science or a related field is required. Master’s degree is a plus.What We OfferCompetitive compensation packages that include salary, bonuses, and stock grants.Generous benefits, including three weeks of paid vacation, medical, dental, and vision insurance, and fully paid family leave.Strong startup culture with catered lunches, casual dress code, happy hours, and more.To make sure we hire the most qualified people, we’ve designed a multi-step selection process that may include interviews, a homework assignment, and a reference check. We’re excited to get to know you and hope you’re ready to give this opportunity everything you’ve got!Redfin is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce.

job_title: Sr. Data Analyst, Global Client Payments
description:
Job Responsibilities:

Analyze and visualize data to inform and assist stakeholders.Work with Python, SQL, various visualization engines, and Amazon Web Services.Collaborate with other team members to build and optimize our data lake and data warehouse.Offer strategic guidance to peers and business teams on how to best leverage our data.Present findings among peers and stakeholders. Socialize projects and results that help inform Avalara and guide the business.Talk directly to stakeholders and management about problems relevant to the business. Work together with other team members on making incremental improvements.Implement production processes in cloud architectures with a high degree of automation.Help facilitate Business automation vs People Power. You and the other payments team members will tackle the unique challenges that occur at the intersection of software and people-driven tasks and apply these solutions to the novel business automation that Avalara aims to create.Better data awareness and analysis plus innovation is what drives our success - help us keep pushing the bar higher.

Job Requirements/Qualifications:

3+ years of experience in SQL, DAX, M, Python, or similar data related languagesYou are an excellent communicator, used to distilling complex technical topics down to actionable insights to advise stakeholders at all levels of the organization.You have demonstrated experience with data and statistics. This includes applying relevant data analysis to inform and potentially guide projects where the goals are potentially unclear, and the risks are unknown.You work in a collaborative team environment. This includes mentoring, teaching, asking, and answering questions, and communicating with your colleagues.You know how to code in Python. You have written production level code which your peers have reviewed and approved of.You know data - structured and unstructured. It may have been difficult to access, challenging to load and parse, but if it is recorded, you have had to dig it out.You know how to work with cloud technologies. You can talk about systems which scale beyond your local computer and think through design patterns for distributed systems.You are proficient in SQL—you can write advanced and efficient queries while working with terabyte sized datasets.Experience with at least one major relational database is required (MySQL, Redshift, etc.).You have proven analytical and quantitative ability and a passion for enabling customers to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses.You can lead projects with multiple stakeholders.Experienced in reviewing others' work, offering feedback, and instilling best practices.You are an experienced data manipulator with proficiency using ETL processes across multiple systems.”You work to build your skill set through continuous learning.Experience with a software as a service businessKnowledge of banking and payment transactions (nice to have)AWS certifications / experienceExperience with containerized applications and environmentsWorking knowledge of SPSS, R, Orange, etc.

SIHB Core CompetenciesCore Competencies are foundational commitments and skills that all SIHB staff are expected to develop. These competencies define common measures for performance that are applied to every role in the organization.Commitment to Indigenous and Organizational Values: Everything we do at SIHB is centered on Traditional Indian Medicine. It is our responsibility to maintain cultural integrity in all that we do.Accountability: All employees of SIHB effectively manage their own work and the work of their teams. We take ownership of our actions and decisions. We all strive to deliver the highest quality work and care, while respecting our teammates and relatives.Collaboration: SIHB is a team-oriented organization. As team members, we share the responsibility of working toward a common purpose. We collaborate with our colleagues across the organization to deliver the highest quality of care and results in alignment with our mission, vision, values and Theory of Change.Communication: We practice effective and clear communication with staff, relatives, teams and community. We demonstrate empathy among each other and with those we serve, and transparency in our decision making.Customer Service Orientation: All employees of SIHB recognize the needs of the diverse community we serve. We put the needs of our relatives first by delivering the highest quality, professional, responsive, and innovative care. Our relatives come first and deserve the best.Position Summary:The Data Analyst Manager will have a strong technical background in data visualization, data architecture and analytics, as well as the ability to lead and coordinate the efforts of a growing team of data analysts and data coordinators. The Manager will work closely with SIHB’s Executive Leadership Team to design, execute, and champion SIHB’s internal data infrastructure to deliver analytics and insights for clinical outcomes, business operations, and external reporting requirements.Organizational Structure/Reporting Relationships:This position reports directly to the Scientific Director and will manage a Data Analysts staff.Organizational ResponsibilitiesHold Indigenous values and practices with respect and integrityHold yourself accountable to the highest standard by being resourceful, innovative, creative and solutions-orientedActively participate in organizational activities with the understanding that success is achieved through teamwork.Recognize that communication is central to the organization’s success and actively champion your words and actions to maintain respect for others, encourage constructive feedback, be open to share laughter and acknowledge differences in skills and opinions, all while keeping others’ best intentions in mind.At SIHB, we refer to our customers as Relatives. Our Relatives come first and deserve the best. Serve the needs of our Relatives first by delivering the highest quality, professional, responsive and innovative care.Job Responsibilities:Supervise, lead, and develop a growing team of data analysts and data coordinators.Oversee all analytic and reporting operations to ensure quality.Manage a team working on intra-organizational data requests and plan for reporting projects.Collaborate with variety of departments to identify data sources and inform proper data usage.Understand organizational needs and objectives –clinical, operational, and externally required.Partner with organizational leaders to define organization-wide metrics and identify relevant data sources.Develop strategies for effective data extraction, analysis, and reporting.Develop test plans and test data for operating systems, implementation plans and system demonstrations.Build systems to transform raw data from multiple sources into actionable organizational insights – patient population health and operational-that interface with clinical electronic health record system and for housing of other national datasets.Utilizing a shared service model, design an infrastructure to support request generation, management and workflow transparency.Build data dashboard that interfaces with clinical data and population health data.Deliver updates as needed to Senior Leadership on team progress, identifying obstacles and opportunities to ensure goals and objectives are met.Serves as professional consultant to various organizations and committees.Provide technical analysis for complex grants or projects.Develop work scopes and schedules for special projects.Write complex analytical or program evaluation reports.Make staff hiring recommendations.Supervise and coordinate information technology projects.Work with diverse stakeholders (leadership, clinical staff, institutional grants, finance, data team) to ensure timely completion an accurate execution of internal data requests.Execute vision for in-house data systems that allow for efficient data extraction and analysis;Provide leadership and technical assistance to other Urban Indian Health Programs on data systems.Requirements and Qualifications:Health and social issues facing AI/ANs and a desire to promote the delivery of appropriate health services to this population.Intermediate to advance statistical and analytic skills and knowledge of research methods and design, data collection, and analysis.Preparing data for analysis and conduction data analyses with minimal assistanceEpidemiological and bio-statistical principles and methods, including but not limited to simple descriptive statistics, single and multiple linear regression analysisUsing Excel, R, and SQL; familiarity with business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, SAS)National, state, and local surveillance data and/or surveys.Excellent writing, speaking ability, and strong interpersonal communication skills, including the ability to explain methodology and findings in lay terms.Database methods and techniques.Principles and practices of information technologySupervisory methods and techniques.Facilitation and negotiation skills; knowledge of negotiation principles.Education Requirements:Bachelor’s DegreeMinimum 6 years data analysis and program management experienceSupervisor experiencePreferred Requirements:Master’s degree with a minimum of 3-5 years program management, data analysis and supervision experienceWork Environment:Office hours are 8-5, Monday through Friday with occasional extra hours for events or to meet deadlines.

Puget Sound Energy is looking to grow our community with like-minded, top talented individuals like you! With our rapidly growing, award winning energy efficiency programs, our pathway to an exciting and innovative future is now.

PSE's IT Application Solutions team is looking for qualified candidates to fill an open Senior Data Governance Analyst position!
Job Description As an essential member of the Data Services team, you will work with the Puget Sound Energy analytics and Data Governance community to develop, evolve and implement effective, best-practice approaches to data collection, data quality analysis, measurement, monitoring, analysis and reporting for Data Enablement initiatives and channels including digital media, web, search, structured data and unstructured information.

Upholds the safety compliance standards inherent in PSE’s operating and/or field procedures related to work responsibilities. Promotes and supports a culture of total safety.Job Responsibilities 

Provide strong SQL development experience and ability to easily navigate through SQL Server or Oracle DBMSSupport the development of detailed and effective Data Quality analytics capabilities, and work with business colleagues to identify, prioritize and execute data quality profiling, cleansing and mitigation processesLead the creation of Data Governance process modeling and standards creation. Demonstrate familiarity with technical tools such as PowerBI and HANA StudioUse SAP Information Steward or Informatica Data Quality profiling and analytical tools to assess and remediate data and information qualityUnderstanding of MDM strategies and concepts, application, and impact to data analytics efforts. Proven experience and success with modeling & use of metadataUnderstanding of MDM strategies and concepts, application, and impact to data analytics efforts. Proven experience and success with modeling & use of metadataHelp PSE to optimize user experience through information and data analysisCapture, interpret and present data and insights to support data enablement strategies, solve business challenges, and drive efficiencies in technical and business performanceHelp build our analytics capabilities to support our digital transformation, risk management and data enablement efforts for our keys systems such as SAPImprove or create data management workflow, data flow diagrams and related processesPartner with our external vendors, our business teams and internal stakeholders to define, capture, develop and deliver on core business metrics and KPIs that support key requirements for our company's initiatives and objectives, including related analysis and planning, reporting and ongoing project support across our organization.Work closely with the Manager of Data Services to engage technical and business stakeholders to solve data and information challengesPartner with other data and business analysts to support predictive and prescriptive modeling and visualization effortsEnsure accuracy of all fact and dimensional data related to channels, sources of acquisition, frequency, transactions and significance testingGenerate ad hoc reports and test datasets or report information for end-users using system tools and database or data warehouse queries and scripts
Minimum Qualifications 

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, Business Administration, or related field.5+ years IT experience, including several years of systems development experience in the design and development of department-wide or enterprise-wide applications.Detailed understanding and 5+ years programming languages (specialized technical requirements as shown in attachment) and strong knowledge of office applications (e.g. Microsoft Office).Possesses full technical knowledge of phases of software development life cycle.Experience with at least two full life cycle implementations of a new application or purchased application.Extensive knowledge of multiple languages, i.e (specialized technical requirements as shown in attachment) environment, active business processes, business areas, as well as industry.Knowledge of systems and/or business analysis design concepts. Demonstrated proficiency in the applied use of systems and process analysis tools. Full system life cycle experience, including development lifecycle methodologies.Demonstrated understanding of Structured Query Language (SQL).Ability to facilitate interactive design and functional specification sessions.Highly developed interpersonal, written and verbal skills with an ability to express complex technical concepts in business terms. Excellent technical writing and system documentation skills.Strong analytical problem-solving, and conceptual skills. Demonstrated project management skills for moderate sized projects. Must be a “team player” able to work with management in developing and implementing new processes and enabling systems. Able to work with end user groups to define application needs and identify feasible solutions. Proactive, self-motivated with the ability to motivate others and a customer-focused service attitude.Good organizational skills, with the ability to meet objectives and effectively multi-task.Ability to work with multiple levels of the organization, both technical and non-technical.
Desired Qualifications 

An analytical approach to problem-solving, coupled with the ability to conceptualize systems. Highly developed interpersonal, written and verbal skills with an ability to express complex technical concepts in business terms. Excellent technical writing and system documentation skills. Experience with and ability to easily navigate through AWS Experience working with HP Quality Center for testing management and monitoring. Demonstrated success in building and sustaining a robust analytics capability for an organization,Demonstrated ability to develop tool sets and approaches for data management processes as well as educate others on how to apply these processes

Eurest is recognized worldwide for standards of service and excellence within the foodservice industry. Embracing an ownership mindset, Eurest leverages global resources, promotes a local presence and enriches the communities we serve. The Eurest Promise, “connect with people, inspire through food, create solutions, and live our promise,” is exemplified throughout our organization. Eurest is proud to serve the world’s most respected successful corporations, including many of the Fortune 500.

SUMMARY

We are looking for a Power BI Analystwho will be responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of Power BI dashboards and reports supporting Business Intelligence using Microsoft Power BI. Here you will analyze data to create Executive level key reports to help drive our innovative initiatives within hospitality.

You are a creative thinker who understands user interface design and melds visualizations skills such as user experience design, data visualization and graphical design.

You are responsible for providing business stakeholders with fact-based decision-making results, enabling them to quickly make changes, as appropriate, that may affect diverse areas.

You are a team player with a positive attitude, collaborative mindset and excellent interpersonal and motivational skills, who can work well with technical and non-technical staff across numerous areas. The candidate should also be able to manage competing priorities through effective communication and time management skills.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following: (other duties may be assigned)

Translate ad-hoc requests into re-usable data products that scale to answer larger questionsPartner with stakeholders to help guide and understand their analytical thought processDevelop robust data visualization products that clearly communicate ideasDefine and owns metrics that capture the spirit of business objectives as closely as possibleWork with business stakeholders and other analysts to maintain the consistency and reliability of the data warehouseBoil technical findings down into business recommendationsWork with business stakeholders to drive business results

TECHNICAL QUALIFICATIONS

3+ years of Business Intelligence experience in a professional settingProficiency with SQL, including relational database experienceProficiency with Power BI and data visualization Experience with Azure services a plus

OTHER QUALIFICATIONS

Strong oral and written communication skills and are able to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to a broad range of audiencesExcellent people and management skills to interact with colleagues, cross-functional teams and stakeholders3+ years building tailored Power BI visualizations and defining required supporting data architecture (e.g., data marts).Experience collaborating with both business and IT partners to identify key use cases and define associated requirements.Provide thought leadership, best practices, and standards required to deliver effective and sustainable solutions to clients.Experience writing & validating complex SQL queriesStrong attention to detail, coupled with a deep bias to action and a healthy dose of pragmatismExperience gathering requirements and talking to usersFamiliarity with basic design concepts & common dashboard development patternsProven ability to execute on projects quickly; get things done mentalityUnabashed question asker; willing to learn anything needed to get things done

Education: Bachelor’s degree preferred and 3+ years of professional experience as a BI Analyst
